importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news release indicates the timing of the public announcement of Doug Martin's death following his arrest and subsequent hospitalization.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred on Saturday, October 4, 2025, and the public announcement of Martin's death and related details came on Monday, October 20, 2025, indicating a timeline of events and public response.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died after a brief struggle with police during an arrest for a break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin was a 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft and had a successful career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
He accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in his NFL career, and was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest, but did not provide further details.
An autopsy will be conducted to determine the cause of death, which has not yet been released.
Martin’s family requested privacy during their grief, and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers issued statements expressing condolences.
This incident raises concerns about police interactions with individuals of high public profile and potential racial or social tensions in law enforcement contexts.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It highlights Martin’s background and early career path that led to his NFL selection and professional success.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with Oakland police during an arrest related to a break-in at a home in Oakland on Saturday, October 4, 2025. Martin, a 31st overall draft pick in 2012 and a key player for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was hospitalized and later died at age 36. His family requested privacy, and officials including Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee and the Buccaneers released statements expressing condolences. The Oakland Police Department reported a brief struggle but did not provide further details. An autopsy will be conducted to determine the cause of death, which has not been released. The incident has sparked broader public and institutional attention on police interactions with individuals of high public profile and the importance of accountability in law enforcement.
tags: racial or social tensions in policing
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention During Break-In Investigation in Oakland
